not a lot of wubi users here. im afriad. the purple screen, can you tell if it is grub, or is it plymouth? ie is it after you selected to boot to wubi or before? If it is after have you tried pressing the up arrow?
in plymouth the up arrow drops you back to the framebuffer so you can see kernel messages

its helpful if there is some kind of issue with the hardware as you can usually see what is causing the kernel to get stuck. if the problem is grub not being able to find the wubi image file on the ntfs partition that i have no idea how to help with, except to suggest not using wubi
whats happing is
AFAIK the wubi image file is just an ext4 file you can loopmount. so boot your livecd and loop mount the wubi image file
could u simpifly what u are saying to me thanks

wubi has a file which is an image file of the contents of wubi's / partition. the livecd can mount the ntfs partition to /media/NTFS or something, and then you can loop mount (just a fancy way to say mount this file as if it were a device) the wubi image file to /media/wubi
then you can recover your data/move it outside the wubi image file to the ntfs partition and have it accessible under windows
best to wait until you have booted the livecd then we can walk you through it.
you may have to install a client, but yes as long as you can get online you can get to irc from the livecd
